body_html:
Metrics uses so called a _safe_div, which returns 0 if denominator <= 0, else numerator/denominator.
In this example reduce_sum(weights) is < 0.
Having total weights negative seems very unusual. Could you please explain what is the use case?
body_text:
Metrics uses so called a _safe_div, which returns 0 if denominator <= 0, else numerator/denominator.
In this example reduce_sum(weights) is < 0.
Having total weights negative seems very unusual. Could you please explain what is the use case?
body:
Metrics uses so called a `_safe_div`, which returns `0 if denominator <= 0, else numerator/denominator`. 
In this example `reduce_sum(weights)` is < 0. 
Having total weights negative seems very unusual. Could you please explain what is the use case?
